channel.title: werk.statt.codes
channel.description: Personal blog on stuff related to R

item.title: How often do Austria's Chancellors use the word 'I'
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: In a previous post, I detailed how to extract statements given in Austria's parliament from the sessions' transcripts. In this post, I use the extracted text - in combination with an already existing database on earlier sessions - to compare chancellors' engagement with parliament and ...their use of the word 'I'.

item.title: How to extract speeches held at Austria's parliament
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: The website of the Austrian parliament provides transcripts of its sessions. This post details how to extract the statements given by MPs, members of government and other speakers.

item.title: Extracting the transcripts of the 'Ibizia Inquiry'
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: In mid-June, the so-called 'Ibiza Commission of Inquiry' heard its last witness after almost one year at work. The commission had been established by the Austrian Parliament and set up to investigate the prevalence of corruption during the coalition government of the ÖVP and FPÖ (Dec, 2017 - May, 2019). This post diggs into its published transcripts. The emphasis of the post is, first, on demonstrating how to extract the text from the hearings' transcripts in R and, second, on crunching a few numbers to get some substantive insights. The compiled dataset, covering all statements (incl. questions, answers etc.), is available for download.

item.title: Austria's Covid legislation: The remarkable absence of authorship in public submissions to the consultative process
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Austria's legislative procedure provides for a consultative process which allows all citizens to make submissions in which they can raise their concerns as to a proposed bill. When making such a submission, submitters can decide whether their authorship and submission are published on the website of the parliament. Remarkably, the share of undisclosed authorships and statements is particularly high with bills introducing various restrictions to curtail the Covid epidemic.

item.title: Thank you {blogdown}, hello {distill}.
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: A few notes on moving from blogdown to distill.

item.title: Austria's Covid legislation: Duration of parliamentarian consultation period in comparison.
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: A (relative) deep dive into the length of the public consultation period for draft bills in Austria, and whether three days for three pages are actually 'normal'.

item.title: Similarity of public submissions to Austria's amendment of the epidemic law
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: An analysis of public submissions to bill seeking to amend Austria's epidemic law.

item.title: Vienna Elections 2020: Analysis of parties' ads on facebook
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Analysis of the facebook ads placed in the run-up to the 2020 Vienna city elections.

item.title: Static maps with mapbox background images (snapbox)

item.description: How to create ggplot maps with mapbox images as background

item.title: Recreating NYT election map
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: How to re-create election maps by the NYT with ggplot.

item.title: Vienna Elections 2020: Age profile of electoral candidates
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: An empirical look at candidates' age.

item.title: Austrian Parliament: MPs transparency and conflict of interest report
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Analysis of Austria MP's transparency reports.

item.title: Update on Google mobility reports on Austria
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: This is a short update on my previous post dealing with Google’s mobility reports on Austria during the Covid-19 crisis.

item.title: Google's Mobility reports: changes to mobility patterns during Covid-19 lock-down in Austria
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Analysis of Google's mobility reports following introductino of Covid lockdown in March 2020.

item.title: Corona Virus in Austria: Updates on data
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Preliminary look at the COVID data on Austria.

item.title: Segregation in Vienna's primary schools?
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Drawing on public data from Vienna's school administration I look at how many percentages of pupils in each primary school subsequently leave for schools offering eventually a higher education entrance qualification (Matura). The main interest is in contrasting these ratios between closely (geo-)located schools.

item.title: Bosnia: Voting behavior of MPs in the House of Representatives
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: Creating and analysing a new dataset on the voting behavior of BiH's members of the House of Representatives.

item.title: Austrian General Elections 2019: Preference votes
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: A look at the distribution of preference votes casted in the 2019 general elections.

item.title: Women in parliament
item.dc:creator: Roland Schmidt
item.description: How well are women represented in Austria's new parliament. A comparative look at the female share of MPs.
